TopicTitle: Who else has noticed this on the wiki?

Articles.Content: Just now, while I was looking through the planets and moons pages, I noticed something about the gallery. Most of the images are basically bragging about how good they are at the game. Most of them are people's space bases and colonies, and very few are actually pictures of just what the actual planet looks like without a probe or station or space base in the way.

How do you take a picture of a planet's surface without landing there? And if they did a lot of work to get a station on a planet, i say they deserve bragging rights for all the effort and if they built a colony they should get a quadruple high five.

Edited February 21, 2014 by Astronaut

You can simply frame the shot away from your epik base. If you really want to be discreet you can use an external camera mod and set up the camera pointed away from your vessel. This hase the added benift of giving more control over camera position then you'd get with stock.

The planet pages are for information about the planets, not player achievements. If you want to show off your work the wiki user pages and the forum's mission report section and blog system are at your disposal.
